Models¶

Model Loader

This gnarly script walks through the model directory and loads each model into the model module namespace so that we can eg. from model import Player rather than the more verbose from model.player import Player.

class game.models.Day(id, number, phase, school)¶
game.models.receiver(signal, **kwargs)[source]¶

A decorator for connecting receivers to signals. Used by passing in the signal (or list of signals) and keyword arguments to connect:

@receiver(post_save, sender=MyModel)
def signal_receiver(sender, **kwargs):
    ...

@receiver([post_save, post_delete], sender=MyModel)
def signals_receiver(sender, **kwargs):
    ...
class game.models.Gladiator(id, name, value, fame, agility, strength, endurance, recruited, reserved, recruited_on, killed_on, school)[source]¶
recruit()[source]¶

Recruit a candidate gladiator.

Updates the current gladiator object to reflect that it has been recruited.

class game.models.Match(id, win_reward, lose_reward, day)[source]¶
class game.models.Participation(id, victor, gladiator, match)[source]¶
class game.models.Player(id, name, user)[source]¶
class game.models.User(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Users within the Django authentication system are represented by this model.

Username, password and email are required. Other fields are optional.

@receiver(post_save, sender=MyModel)
